title: Facebook wins preliminary approval to settle facial recognition lawsuit
text: Facebook Inc won preliminary approval late on Wednesday from a federal court for settlement of a lawsuit that claimed it illegally collected and stored biometric data of millions of users without their consent.

title: Top Facebook executive in India files criminal complaint against a journalist for sharing news report
text: Ankhi Das, a top Facebook executive in India, has filed a criminal complaint against a journalist who she alleges attempted to defame her in a public Facebook post and made “sexually coloured remarks.” A review of the journalist Awesh Tiwari’s post, written in Hindi (the most widely spoken language in India), finds that it was […]

title: Zoom Video to Soon Appear on Amazon, Facebook, and Google Smart Display Devices
text: The videoconferencing specialist is broadening its reach into the home office.

title: Facebook announces changes to support beleaguered Black-owned businesses nationwide
text: Facebook is boosting its support of Black-owned small business in America, allocating millions in grants to this hard-hit sector.

title: Zoom Video's for home service to expand to Amazon's Echo, Facebook's Portal and Google's Nest
text: Zoom Video Communications Inc. ZM, -0.65% said Wednesday that its Zoom for Home service will expand to at-home smart display devices, including Amazon.com Inc.

title: Exclusive: Facebook employees internally question policy after India content controversy - sources, memos
text: Facebook and its top lobbying executive in India, Ankhi Das, are facing questions internally from employees over how political content is regulated in its biggest market, according to sources with direct knowledge and internal posts seen by Reuters.

title: Facebook Portal to add Zoom and other conferencing apps to its video chat devices
text: The social network is making a bigger play to get Portal devices into people's home offices.

title: Facebook Portal gets serious about remote work with BlueJeans, GoToMeeting, Webex and Zoom apps
text: Facebook’s Portal line didn’t get off to the smoothest start when it launched back in 2018. The company no doubt realized from the outset that it would have a lot to prove on the privacy front when attempting to convince users to essentially invite a Facebook-powered camera into their living quarters.

title: Facebook is turning Portal into a screen for Zoom calls
text:
The friends-and-family-oriented video-calling gadget is adding support for Zoom, Webex, GoToMeeting, and BlueJeans videoconferencing.
When the COVID-19 pandemic made social distancing into the sudden norm, a bunch of not-especially-high-profile technology products entered the spotlight.

title: Zoom is coming to Facebook's video-chat device, Portal
text: Facebook announced that video conferencing apps headlined by Zoom will be coming to its Portal video-calling devices in September.

title: Facebook Is About to Start Harvesting Oculus User Data
A new report says Facebook’s anti-misinformation strategy isn’t working
text:
As the ‘Plandemic’ COVID-19 hoax video gets a sequel, an activist group concludes that Facebook’s effort to combat misinformation doesn’t go far enough.
 Plandemic, the viral conspiracy-laden video that claims the COVID-19 outbreak was orchestrated by government officials and billionaires, is back—now in feature-length form.

title: Oculus' Move To Make Facebook Accounts Mandatory For Users Of Its VR Headsets Sparks Social Media Outrage
text: Virtual reality headset maker Oculus announced Tuesday that a user account with parent company Facebook Inc's (NASDAQ: FB) namesake social media platform would be necessary to log into its devices beginning October 2020.
